message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest rheumatoid arthritis, which is supported by the x-ray findings. Methotrexate is a first-line therapy for rheumatoid arthritis. Adalimumab and Prednisolone are also used to treat rheumatoid arthritis, but are typically reserved for patients who have failed methotrexate therapy. Diclofenac is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) commonly used for pain relief, but it does not treat the underlying disease.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient presents with symptoms suggestive of rheumatoid arthritis, which is confirmed by the x-ray findings showing erosions and joint space narrowing. Methotrexate is a first-line therapy for rheumatoid arthritis. Adalimumab and Prednisolone are also used to treat rheumatoid arthritis, but Methotrexate is preferred as initial therapy. Diclofenac is an NSAID and may be used for pain relief, but it does not address the underlying disease process.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms, as well as the x-ray, suggest rheumatoid arthritis. Methotrexate is the first-line disease-modifying anti-rheumatic drug (DMARD) for rheumatoid arthritis. Adalimumab is a biologic DMARD that can be used if methotrexate is ineffective, but it is not the first-line treatment. Prednisolone is a corticosteroid that can be used to quickly reduce inflammation but is not a long-term solution. Diclofenac is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) that can be used for symptom relief but is not a DMARD.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest rheumatoid arthritis, and methotrexate is a first-line therapy for rheumatoid arthritis. Adalimumab is also used for rheumatoid arthritis, but not as a first-line therapy. Prednisolone and diclofenac can provide pain relief but they do not modify the course of the disease like methotrexate.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest rheumatoid arthritis, which is supported by the x-ray findings. Among the options, methotrexate is a first-line treatment for rheumatoid arthritis. Adalimumab is also used, but it is typically reserved for more severe cases. Prednisolone can be used for acute exacerbations, but it is not a long-term solution. Diclofenac can provide symptomatic relief but does not treat the underlying inflammation.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and family history suggest rheumatoid arthritis, which is characterized by symmetric joint pain and stiffness, and is treated with disease-modifying antirheumatic drugs (DMARDs) such as methotrexate. Adalimumab is also a DMARD and can be used in moderate to severe rheumatoid arthritis, but it’s not the first choice. Prednisolone is a corticosteroid used for acute exacerbations of rheumatoid arthritis or in combination with DMARDs. Diclofenac is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug used for treating acute arthritic attacks or for symptomatic relief, but it does not modify the disease course.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's symptoms and family history suggest rheumatoid arthritis. Methotrexate is considered the first-line therapy for rheumatoid arthritis. Adalimumab is a second-line therapy and more commonly used in patients who have failed methotrexate. Prednisolone is a corticosteroid and can be used for short-term relief of symptoms but is not a long-term treatment option. Diclofenac is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug and can provide short-term symptomatic relief, but is not a disease-modifying therapy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms of pain, stiffness, and fever suggest rheumatoid arthritis. Methotrexate is an immunosuppressant used to treat rheumatoid arthritis. Adalimumab is also used to treat rheumatoid arthritis, but it is usually reserved for patients who do not respond to methotrexate. Prednisolone is a glucocorticoid also used to treat rheumatoid arthritis but is often used in low doses or for short courses due to its side effects. Diclofenac is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to treat pain and inflammation but is not the first-line therapy for rheumatoid arthritis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The x-ray shows erosions and narrowing of the joint spaces, which is indicative of rheumatoid arthritis. Among the options, Methotrexate is a commonly used disease-modifying antirheumatic drug for rheumatoid arthritis. Adalimumab is a biologic agent used for moderate-to-severe rheumatoid arthritis, but is typically used after methotrexate. Prednisolone and Diclofenac may help with pain relief, but do not address the underlying disease process.

Adalimumab is a second-line option typically used if methotrexate is not effective. Prednisolone and diclofenac may provide symptomatic relief, but do not treat the underlying disease.
